intro: Jatropha loasoides, commonly known as the red-veined jatropha, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features palmate leaves with reddish veins and produces yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage. However, it contains toxic compounds and should be handled with care.
